snippet: When the Pennsylvania city was down to its last $5,000 last week, its mayor cut city workers’ pay, including his own. Now Scranton’s unions are fighting for their wages in court.
abstract: Scranton, Pa, finds itself down to its last $5,000, and Mayor Christopher A Doherty cuts the pay of city workers to the minimum wage; city's unions are fighting for their promised wages in court; troubles of the city of 76,000 are a combination of long-term structural decline, a mayor and City Council at loggerheads and an inability to borrow.

byline.original: By MICHAEL COOPER and MARY WILLIAMS WALSH

lead_paragraph: When the Pennsylvania city was down to its last $5,000 last week, its mayor cut city workers’ pay, including his own. Now Scranton’s unions are fighting for their wages in court.

headline.seo: Unions Fight Scranton Mayor After He Cuts Pay to Minimum Wage
headline.main: Unions Fight Scranton Mayor After He Cuts Pay to Minimum Wage
headline.print_headline: Unions Fight Scranton Mayor After He Cuts Pay to Minimum Wage
